Mr. Pulitzer has practiced law for over 19 years and has expertise concentrated in technology law and related intellectual property issues. He represents a broad range of clients, from start-up entrepreneurs to multinational corporations. He has extensive experience in structuring, drafting and negotiating a wide range of transactions in the e-commerce and information technology industries, including strategic alliances, joint ventures and other partnership arrangements; trademark, copyright, patent, trade secret and technology licensing agreements; design, development and distribution agreements; agreements for technology-related services (including data center lease agreements and SLAs), outsourcing due diligence and agreements, marketing and co-branding agreements; and agreements related to the conduct of business in electronic forms and media. His practice includes strategic intellectual property asset purchases, sales, use and protection.

Mr. Pulitzer also advises companies on issues of moving to a web-based environment and implementing an e-commerce infrastructure, setting up of and maintaining of a web presence, cloud computing, software as a service, social media issues, business and compliance issues, open source issues, privacy and data security matters and branding issues.
